content: USTR determinations in TRIPS Agreement investigations. The Trade Act of 1974 is amended to include investigations involving intellectual property rights under the TRIPS Agreement and GATT 1994. Timeframes for TRIPS Agreement determinations are also specified. The Trade Representative must make determinations regarding intellectual property rights under the TRIPS Agreement and GATT 1994 within specific timeframes. A conforming amendment is made to the Trade Act of 1974. SEC. 2. Petitions for review under ATPA and CBERA are amended to ensure timely reconsideration of beneficiary country status. SEC. 3. Adequate and effective protection of intellectual property rights under GSP. Section 502(c) of the Trade Act of 1974 is amended to ensure compliance with intellectual property rights agreements. Section 212(c) of the Caribbean Basin Economic Recovery Act is amended to address compliance with intellectual property rights agreements, specifically mentioning the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights. Additionally, Section 213(b)(5)(B)(ii) is revised to evaluate the protection of intellectual property rights in CBTPA beneficiary countries. The Andean Trade Preference Act is amended to ensure that beneficiary countries provide adequate protection of intellectual property rights, even if they are in compliance with specific obligations of the Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights.
